revised_title: Environmental Effects Transmission in Simocephalus Vetulus
tldr: The author conducted experiments on Simocephalus vetulus, a type of Daphnid, to study the transmission of environmental effects from parent to offspring. They discovered that certain environmental changes, such as high temperatures, can cause physical changes in the offspring that persist even after returning to normal conditions. This research sheds light on the concept of parallel induction and the potential for environmental factors to influence the development and characteristics of future generations.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Epigenetics
